main event: Multiple sightings of bright, oval-shaped, multi-colored lights moving at high speeds and exhibiting unusual behavior in the skies over New Delhi, India on various dates in July 1959.
interesting points: One sighting described the lights as football-sized, oval, and colored red, green, and blue, moving at high speed for 3 minutes before disappearing.
Observations were made by both military and civilian sources, indicating the credibility of the witnesses.
The reported object exhibited characteristics of a meteor but also changed course and speed, which is unusual for a meteor.
One report detailed an unidentified light considerably brighter and larger than any star or conventional aircraft, moving at a high rate of speed and suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view.
There was no evidence of any conventional aircraft or satellite in the area at the time of the sightings.
